definition: to idle about
to swim/variant of 遊|游[you2]
to walk/to tour/to roam/to travel
surname You
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
enclosure/(variant of 閒|闲[xian2]) idle/unoccupied/leisure
idle/unoccupied/leisure

sentences.english: With open shop for inheritance award-winning uncomplicated, full-time immersed collection.
sentences.chinese: 以开网店为业的林强游手好闲，全日沉浸收集。

sentences.english: He is a dropout, and messes around all day.
sentences.chinese: 他是一名流失生，整天游手好闲。

sentences.english: Tom didn't get promoted because he goofed off all the time and never did his homework.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆没有升级，因为他老是游手好闲，不做功课。

sentences.english: He wouldn't drone when he may live by honest labour.
sentences.chinese: 他可凭诚实的劳动生活时，他不愿游手好闲。

sentences.english: You are not lazy, and still you are an idler.
sentences.chinese: 你并不懒惰，但却算得上是个游手好闲的人。

sentences.english: I was sort of goof-off, " Obama admitted."
sentences.chinese: 我有点游手好闲，”奥巴马承认。

sentences.english: I don't like to see young people loafing about the town with nothing to do.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢看到年轻人游手好闲地在城里逛荡。

sentences.english: She's become quite a gadabout since she left home.
sentences.chinese: 自从离家以后，她变成了一个十足游手好闲的人。

sentences.english: My best friend won the high school senior goof-off award.
sentences.chinese: 我最要好的朋友赢得高三的“游手好闲”奖。

sentences.english: I will not be a mental loafer.
sentences.chinese: 我不想成为一个游手好闲的人。

sentences.english: The harshness of recent reality disentranced him from his idleness.
sentences.chinese: 最近的严酷现实使他醒悟，不再游手好闲了。

sentences.english: He idled about and did no decent work.

sentences.chinese: 他们游手好闲地消磨时间。

sentences.english: He is a sort of happy-go-lucky, never thinks of getting a job.
sentences.chinese: 他是个游手好闲的人，从未想找工作做。

definition: happy to partake but not prepared to do any work (idiom)/all take and no give
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
to love ease and comfort and hate work (idiom)
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
without learning or skills (idiom); ignorant and incompetent
to go dining, wining, whoring and gambling/to lead a life of dissipation
to muddle along/to live aimlessly
to spend one's time in drinking and pleasure (idiom); to indulge in sensual pleasures/life of debauchery
hedonistic son of rich parents
loafer/idler/bum
not to do anything productive/to idle away one's time
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
unemployed person/vagrant/rogue
to stir up trouble
to have no aspirations (idiom)/unambitious
to oppress the people/to act tyrannically
